gameBonus.label: +5 for losing record
gameBonus.description: Earn 5 bonus points if the cumulative W-L of all visited teams is below .500

info.overviewBrief: Navigate baseball history to collect Hall of Famers across 9 rounds.
info.overview: The OG 'Six Degrees of Goose Gossage'. How many Hall of Famers can you uncover in an 9-team chain of teammates? Pick a player, then pick a team they played for and collect all of their hall-of-fame teammates. Then do it 8 more times to see how many inductees you can collect in your chain. Bonus points for picking bad teams!
howToPlay: You start on a random team+year that has zero Hall of Famers on its roster.
Pick any player on the roster, then choose a different team that player also played for.
You land on the new roster and score 1 point for each Hall of Famer there.
Repeat for 9 rounds. Each Hall of Famer only counts once per game.
bullets: 301 collectible Hall of Famers (players inducted as Player).

info.overviewBrief: Chase All-Star appearances for big point totals.
info.overview: It's HOF-Golf but for all-stars! Each all-star appearance is worth 1 point...except players with 10+ appearances are worth zero (sorry, Cal Ripken)! And...players who have made the midsummer classic just once are worth five (hello, Grant Balfour ... oops, said too much)!
howToPlay: You start on a random 2025 team with exactly one All-Star ‚Äî that one's a freebie.
Pick any player on the roster, then choose a different team that player also played for.
Points equal each player's career All-Star selections (e.g. a 12-time All-Star is worth 12 points).
Repeat for 9 rounds. Each All-Star only counts once per game.
bullets: Target players with lots of selections for big scores.

info.overviewBrief: Find the players who went on to manage.
info.overview: Those who can't play, coach, amirite? Troll those rosters nine times to find those obsure bench players who went onto greatness of a more strategic variety.
howToPlay: You start on a random 2025 team.
Pick any player on the roster, then choose a different team that player also played for.
Score 1 point for each player on the roster who later became a manager.
Repeat for 9 rounds. Each manager-player only counts once per game.
bullets: Players count if they appear on the roster as a player, not as a manager.
